result.name: empty-homes-allocations
result.notes: Bringing empty homes back into use is a priority for the Coalition Government. £70m of this funding has been assigned to the HCA to deliver a programme to bring empty properties back in to use as affordable housing. The dataset lists allocations which could deliver up to 5,600 new affordable homes (2012-2015 delivery)

organization.name: homes-and-communities-agency
organization.title: Homes England
organization.description:
Homes England (formerly The Homes and Communities Agency) is the national housing and regeneration agency for England. It is the regulator of social housing providers and works with local partners to create new affordable homes and thriving neighbourhoods.

Homes England is an executive non-departmental public body, sponsored by the Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/homes-england

result.title: Empty Homes Allocations

extras.value:
Allocations for Empty Homes 2012-15 delivery can be found on the HCA website at:  
http://www.homesandcommunities.co.uk/sites/default/files/our-work/20130701_-_eh2_scheme_listing_final_v4.xls
